result.execSummary:
All charges against Kyle Allen Erbe in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kyle Allen Erbe is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Use or Possess w/ Intent to Use Masking Agent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle Allen Erbe

records.addlTxt: $250.00 bond on file moved to case 22CF72. arc

2:33 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kyle Allen Erbe in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Kyle Allen Erbe. INCLUDES 22CF72 and 22CF434. ADA Damrau recites agreement, amending Cts 1 and 3, Information forthcoming in 22CF72. DE sworn. WOPH in 22CF72: Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. PLEAS: DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Possession of Amphetamine and Ct 3 - Possession of Amphetamine in 22CF72. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Possession of Amphetamine and Ct 3 - Possession of Amphetamine in 22CF72. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Ct 2 in 22CF72 and case 22CF434 in it's entirety. Sentencing arguments. Defendant advised of appeal rights. 

Court orders: 
22CF72
Ct 1 - Possession of Amphetamine
S/W 2 years probation with conditions:
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Random testing at least one time per month by Agent
- Obtain full-time employment or school
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

22CF72
Ct 3 - Possession of Amphetamine
S/W 2 years probation with conditions:
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Random testing at least one time per month by Agent
- Obtain full-time employment or school
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

2 days jail credit.
Apply bond on file, payment plan approved.
Defendant to report to probation no later than 4:00 PM today. 
Adjourned: 2:27 PM. kma

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Dolfi; hereby appointing Atty Dolfi. arc

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing at least 2 times per week, 1 Mouth swab and 1 urine test. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:08 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson.  Prosecuting attorney Karl E Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle Allen Erbe in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Kyle Allen Erbe. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond arguments. Court orders bond. Court sets STC with Branch 1. Court judicially transfers to branch I. Adjourned
Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
